page.title: 02Agriculture - Arable.
page.content: Two thirds of the land is used to grow grass to feed the cattle, sheep and a few goats. The grass is mainly ryegrass and white clover. The few permanent pastures contain cocksfoot, timothy, yorkshire fog and other meadow grasses. Grassland weeds are mainly chickweed, poa, thistles, docks and ragwort. One third of the land grows wheat, barley, maize and fodder beet. Weeds and diseases are controlled by spraying. The grain is harvested by combine and is handled in bulk. Some straw is burnt but most is baled for feeding and bedding stock. All the land is under-drained with plastic or clay pipes. Adequate lime, phosphate, potash and nitrogen are provided to ensure high production.
